items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 30+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Innovation at Elastic never stops and we are thrilled to join the unrivalled team from Opbeat who are currently working hard to fully integrate their Application Performance Monitoring solution into the Elastic Stack. Welcome Elastic APM! We are currently making major changes to the product as we integrate it with the Elastic Stack, and we are now looking for a talented, Senior JavaScript Engineer to work on our Real User Monitoring (RUM) agent as soon as possible.

The goal of the RUM agent is to let developers obtain information about the end user experience of their applications. The agent is a JavaScript library that is injected into the application JavaScript code and runs in the user browser. The application is automatically instrumented in order to measure the end user experience through metrics. It traces initial page load times, regular resources, XHR/fetch requests and other relevant events.

You will be part of a team developing a high quality, open source APM product aimed to help fellow JavaScript developers instrument, debug, and monitor frontend JavaScript applications. As part of the agent team, you’ll be deeply involved with the entire codebase and take on responsibilities for new features, improving the resource footprint and roadmap planning.

Specifically you will be responsible for developing code that integrates with several JavaScript frameworks, including ReactJS.

You will also work closely with the APM Server team when adding new features to the server API and with the UI team to ensure that we deliver the best possible experience for JavaScript developers.

What you will be doing

  • Join the JavaScript RUM Agent APM team alongside one other person on the team.
  • Improve the JavaScript RUM agent.
  • Build new integrations to frameworks like React, Vue.js etc.
  • Handle pull requests and issues from the open source community.
  • Collaborate with APM Server and UI teams to ensure the best experience possible for JavaScript developers

What you will bring

  • 8+ years of experience with JavaScript in-depth experience
  • Previous demonstrable APM experience is required.
  • Knowledge of browser and JavaScript engines inner workings, needed to be able to build a frontend APM agent.
  • Experience working with modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js, Ember, etc).
  • Ability to work independently in a globally distributed team

Additional Information

  • Competitive pay and benefits
  • Option to work 100% remote or from any office
  • Stock options
  • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
  • Passionate people building phenomenal products
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

About Elastic

Elastic builds software to make data usable in real time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012, the company develops the open source Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), X-Pack (commercial features), and Elastic Cloud (a SaaS offering). To date, there have been more than 100 million cumulative downloads. The Elastic community is 100,000 members strong. Thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, NASA, Microsoft, Mayo Clinic, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Backed by Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA with more than $100 million in funding, Elastic has a distributed workforce with more than 600 employees in 30 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

Benefits

401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
Health Care Insurance
Vacation Time Determined By Location
Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
100% Remote work possible

items.title: SVP of Professional Services ($400K/yr) at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

ESW Capital takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on April 28th to hire SVPs of Professional Services (USD $400K/yr).

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

As a Senior Vice President of Professional Services, you will be responsible for managing a $50M/year business. You will interact and sell with the CIO/CTO of the largest telecommunications or enterprise software companies around the world. You will hire, train, and manage 5-10 Vice Presidents each of whom have teams of roughly 30-50 people. A successful candidate will be one with a proven track record of success serving Fortune 100/Global 2000 customers and a deep expertise in the enterprise software consulting industry.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Minimum 10 years of related work experience, including experience managing technical engagements from concept to delivery in enterprise technology settings
  • Experience in a Partner-level role at a top-tier IT consulting company
  • Executive Relationships: Must be able to credibly discuss long-term strategy with F500 CxO-level management.
  • Customer Focus: Deep passion for customer success, coupled with a driving motivation to solve their problems and continually improve their experience - you are a customer advocate of the highest order

Key Responsibilities:

  • Hire train and manage a Crossover-based team of 5-10 Vice Presidents of Project Management
  • Sell and deliver $50M/yr of business through a team of 250-500 people
  • Build, and continually improve, a customer-success focused process and culture based on simplicity, common standards, and metric-based operations.
  • Create ongoing economies of scale, enabling your organization to become more effective and efficient as it grows
  • Establish yourself as the face of the business with our customers, driving their confidence to build and deploy our deep team of consultants to deliver results
  • Continually assess the extent to which each customer is realizing the full potential of their engagement with our software and services, working with them to increase value over time

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Benefits

Work from anywhere
Choose your own hours
Flat organization
Work with talented people all over the world
Committed to diversity
Competitive compensation

Informatica Administrator (Remote Position) - Jobmote

Informatica Administrator (Remote Position)

CACI International Inc

Job Description

CACI serves the U. S. government to include the uniformed services, veterans, and citizens by accelerating the transformation of healthcare through the application of new healthcare strategies and technology. The Defense Health Agency s (DHA) mission is to provide a medically ready force to Combatant Commands in both peacetime and wartime. The DHA supports the delivery of integrated, affordable, and high-quality health services to the MHS (Military Health System) beneficiaries and is responsible for driving greater integration of clinical and business processes across the MHS.

Our team of IT and Health Care specialists provide a wide range of Medical Information Delivery Support (MIDS) for various DoD Medical IT systems and technologies. Our goal is to help SPAWAR and DHA solve enterprise healthcare challenges by delivering advanced data warehousing, cloud-based big data analysis, algorithm development, data quality improvements, decision support tools, and resource/cost efficiencies.

CACI is looking for an experienced Informatica Administrator to work in our Charleston, SC, office or remotely. The Administrator will day to day administration and install and configure Informatica components for both Power Center and Big Data editions. As a secondary duty, the Administrator perform capacity planning and on-going monitoring to proactively increase capacity as required. The individual will work with other developers, testers, DBAs, project managers, and client business users and developers to develop specifications and resolve issues.

Responsibilities:- Install and configure Informatica components for both Power Center and Big Data editions, including high availability; managing server activations and deactivations for all environments; ensuring that all systems and procedures adhere to organizational best practices- Day to day administration of the Informatica Big Data Edition and Power Center suite of services- Manage licensure on Informatica environments- Informatica capacity planning and on-going monitoring (e. g. CPU, Memory, etc.) to proactively increase capacity as required- Consult with users, management, vendors, and technicians sto assess computing needs and system requirements- Work with other developers, testers, DBAs, project managers, and client business users and developers to develop specifications and resolve issues- Perform data profiling and analysis using Informatica suite- Troubleshoot and support production processes- Create and maintain documentation- Monitor ETL workflows and logging, providing job reports and status as required- Perform ETL failure recovery when requiredRequired Skills:- Active DoD Secret Clearance- 6+ years of experience with Informatica 9. 5 or higher as an administrator- 3-5+ years of SQL Server experience with T-SQL, SSIS, SSRS- Familiarity with Kerberos v5. x configuration and integration to Informatica PowerCenter or Big Data Edition- Experience in a data warehouse and BI environment- Experience with Oracle RDMS and associated tools/infrastructure- Experience with installation and upgrade of Informatica PowerCenter 9. 5 or higher- Experience retrieving data from various database platforms, web service APIs, flat files, etc.Desired Skills:- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems; or related field- SSAS knowledge- Experience with Tableau, SAS- Informatica Certification- Security implementation in both Native and LDAP domains- Experience with Military Heath System data- Experience in working Agile/Scrum environment

items.title: Spreedly: Technical Customer Success Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Technical Customer Success Manager

Posted Apr 30

Spreedly
Headquarters: Durham, NC
www.spreedly.com
View all Spreedly jobs →

West Coast Time Zone

Spreedly is seeking an experience technical customer success manager who can jump into the role, start learning, and contribute quickly. We’re a payments API that’s used by developers around the world, so you’ll become a product expert in all things Spreedly. 

You’re a quick thinker, and naturally analytical with a consultative mindset. You’ll be spending the majority of your time answering customer inquiries, researching and troubleshooting customer issues, as well as consistently updating and maintaining documentation and other customer-facing materials to make our customers’ experience with Spreedly as simple as possible.

You are a Customer Success junkie who loves digging into customer use cases and thinking deeply about how to help customers succeed. You’re patient and resilient, with a sense of humor, and a natural ability to listen and educate. Your curiosity and desire to learn are key to your success.

What You'll Do

  • Use self-serve solutions to address inbound customer questions and requests quickly.
  • Research and troubleshoot customer issues by diving into code, putting on your investigator hat, and resolving as many issues as possible without developer resources.
  • Capture and track feedback from customers on new features and product improvements.
  • Discover and analyze gaps in customer experience, identify early warning signals that lead to churn, then work with other teams to address root causes.
  • Build compelling business cases backed by data to introduce new processes or functions that will drive customer success at scale.
  • Create and maintain Help Center and technical documentation to aid in customer education and self-service.

We're Looking For Someone With

  • 3-5+ years of customer support/success experience.
  • Proven experience working and building relationships with technical customers/end users, who are primarily developers, using our API to support commerce businesses.
  • Passion and excitement for how quality customer interactions can drive business growth.
  • Superior verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to thrive in loosely structured environments, and you take ownership to see things through to completion. 
  • Demonstrated ability to work remotely.

Nice To Haves

  • Prior experience at a growth stage SaaS company.
  • Prior experience in the payments industry.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary + equity package
  • Outstanding medical and dental benefits(we pay 100% of monthly premiums for employees + families)
  • Open PTO policy
  • 12 weeks paid family leave for all full- time employees
  • Company sponsored 401k
  • Yearly paid professional development

Our team is largely based in the RDU area of North Carolina, however we are looking for someone remote for this opportunity located on the West Coast of the U.S.

Due to the sensitive nature of what Spreedly does - handling payment data- candidates must complete a successful background check. If you have concerns along those lines, please discuss with us sooner rather than later- we do not want you to waste time in the hiring process and get disqualified at the end if we can help it.

This position reports directly to the Director of Customer Success. Because of the high volume of resume flow, we will only respond to those candidates that we think will be a potential fit.

Currently we are not set up to support remote employees from CA, NY or outside the continental US.


Apply for this position

https://jobs.lever.co/spreedly/f19b3449-0af3-4935-82df-82cd0f2f9d27?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WeWorkRemotely
